page.title: 03Life in Tiptoe Village.
page.content: Mr Alcorn owns and runs Tiptoe's garage. He works with 1 mechanic and has help with the paperwork. The garage is open 6 days a week. He works a 60 hour week doing mechanical work and body repairs and will also work on lawn mowers, bicycles and caravans. The customers are mainly local but some are tourists. Next door is the shop and Post Office run by Mrs Coombes. The shop sells cigarettes, sweets, drink and stationery. The Lockyer family run an animal feed and riding equipment shop on the boundary of Tiptoe and Wootton. They open 6 days a week. Their customers travel from a wide area to the shop. There are two churches in the Tiptoe area - Baptist and Anglican. About 80 people attend Mr McKenzie's Sunday service. A number of clubs use the church.
